Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2014 06:00AM jojo2373 wrote: Slow it feels like its hardly growing for sure - the monthly pics really helped me to see the difference.  The few small things made such a diff - using a flat iron again, feeling my hair move in the wind, buying hair products and being able to use them, and just recently feeling my hair on my collar.  Good things are coming!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 2, 2014 05:58AM - edited Apr 2, 2014 05:59AM by jojo2373 For issues with chemo curl, once you have enough use the mini flatiron!  It can help so much in trying to achieve a style.  The first 9 months of growth is "chemo" hair (per my MO) so any attempts to cut it away won't work.  I really noticed a difference in the texture of my hair after that point.  I am 16 mos pfc and have my "old" hair back now.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Title: Slowing down, quickly approaching first chemo Simplicity sybilskelton

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2014 12:32PM jojo2373 wrote: Hi Roareus, Our dx/treatments sound familiar.  I had extensive lvi, mitotic rate +30, grade 3, 1 pos node.  My MO explained yes my cancer was very agressive but that one positive node was doing its job blocking the cancer from moving on.  Although we realize cells could have moved past, but we treated our bodies with dose dense chemo which was designed to kill those cells right at the point they divide.  Just remember any cancer dx could return, however a high % does not.  Keep looking forward.
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2016 06:59AM jojo2373 wrote: Hi Ladies, I had a bone scan in Sept for lower pain on my ride side. Earlier this year i had a MRI of my lumbar which showed modic and disc dissection in L1 to L5. My bone scan was clear except for uptake in L4 which per the report states "most likely consistent" with MRI results. I have read many stories of women being told its just DDD and it was mets or a friend was told it was mets and then biopsy revealed DDD. I almost want another opinion - anyone else have a bone scan similar and it was nothing?

Posts.Title: January 2013 surgery JRMH Lbwagner69

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2013 07:32AM jojo2373 wrote: Hope, I had to wear the surgical cap for surgery. I chose to be bald under the cap as my DH and daughter had seen me bald daily before so no worries for me. Not sure if you could wear a wig or not? I was told how "bad" I looked in recovery. Ha - no makeup, brows, and bald is plain scary anyway! For the lumpectomy recovery question, for me 4 days after surgery is what it took. I will work from home beginning tomorrow. I feel fine, just sore, bruised, and swollen in underarm and breast. If not for the option for working from home, I would certainly be able to go into the office (I do office work). Anything physical however would be different.
Posts.Title: January 2013 surgery JRMH Lbwagner69

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2013 02:02PM jojo2373 wrote: Auntiem, Amy has it covered but would add don't wait till ur nauseous to take meds with AC. Take them on schedule and keep food in your stomach. To me AC felt like I had the flu for a week after. Take ur Neulasta shot in your stomach, less painful. Ask your MO about Claritan with Taxol. For alot of us it lessens the pain. But most of all join a chemo thread for the month you start and take the journey with others here. The companionship will work miracles for you!
Posts.Title: January 2013 surgery JRMH Lbwagner69

Now to get healed so rads can begin. Hoping everyone has a stress free and healing weekend!
